description: Entry-level AWS certification validating foundational knowledge of cloud concepts, services, security, pricing, and support.
target_candidate: Individuals with up to 6 months of exposure to AWS. No coding or deep architecture design required.

sections.title: Introduction & Course Overview
sections.description: Overview of the course, instructor, and certification value.

sections.title: What is Cloud Computing?
sections.description: Defines cloud computing, its benefits, and evolution from traditional hosting.

sections.title: What is Amazon Web Services (AWS)?
sections.description: History of AWS, its global infrastructure, and its position as a market leader.

sections.title: AWS Global Infrastructure
sections.description: Regions, Availability Zones, Edge Locations, and concepts like data residency and GovCloud.

sections.title: Cloud Architecture & Core Concepts
sections.description: High Availability, Scalability, Elasticity, Fault Tolerance, and Disaster Recovery.

sections.title: AWS Core Services - Compute
sections.description: EC2, Containers (ECS/EKS/Fargate), Serverless (Lambda), and related services.

sections.title: AWS Core Services - Storage
sections.description: S3, EBS, EFS, Glacier, and the Snow Family for data transfer.

sections.title: AWS Core Services - Database
sections.description: RDS, DynamoDB, Redshift, ElastiCache, and Database Migration Service (DMS).

sections.title: AWS Core Services - Networking
sections.description: VPC, Subnets, Route Tables, Internet Gateway, Security Groups, NACLs, CloudFront, and Direct Connect.

sections.title: Security & Compliance (Shared Responsibility Model)
sections.description: CIA Triad, Shared Responsibility Model, IAM, MFA, KMS, and compliance programs (HIPAA, PCI DSS, etc.).

sections.title: Identity & Access Management (IAM)
sections.description: Users, Groups, Roles, Policies, Permission Boundaries, and the Root User.

sections.title: Billing, Pricing, and Support
sections.description: Pricing models (On-Demand, Reserved, Spot), Cost Explorer, Budgets, Trusted Advisor, and Support Plans.

sections.title: Deployment & Management Tools
sections.description: CloudFormation, CDK, Elastic Beanstalk, AWS CLI, and SDKs.

sections.title: Monitoring & Analytics
sections.description: CloudWatch (Metrics, Logs, Alarms), CloudTrail, and AWS X-Ray.

sections.title: Application Integration
sections.description: SQS, SNS, Step Functions, EventBridge, and API Gateway.

sections.title: Migration & Innovation
sections.description: Cloud Adoption Framework, Migration strategies, and concepts like Generative AI and Quantum Computing.

sections.title: Well-Architected Framework
sections.description: The five pillars: Operational Excellence, Security, Reliability, Performance Efficiency, and Cost Optimization.

sections.title: Practice Exams & Final Review
sections.description: Taking full-length practice exams to simulate the real test environment.

study_plan.schedule: 3 sections per week, 1.5â€“2 hours per section

milestones.goal: Complete all sections and practice exams

recommended_activities: Watch freeCodeCamp video course with timestamps
Take notes in Markdown with Mermaid diagrams
Use AWS Free Tier to explore services hands-on
Take practice exams starting from section 15

rules: Do not include out-of-scope services (e.g., RoboMaker, MediaConvert)
Focus on concepts, not CLI commands
Link to AWS docs for deeper learning
Update status after each study session
